definition.text: Use this switch to spawn different types of Weight Votes, and to reference Class types of nodes within any of the Project Definition Hierarchies to map large structures of definitions.

paragraphs.text: You may use this switch for three different purposes:
As an organizational device: You may create arbitrary arrangements of votes, spawning more switches and votes.
As a switch: You may control the flow of Weight Power, pretty much like with a Token Power Switch, but within the Voting Program. If you need a reminder, read about how Token Power Flows.
As a data-structure mapper: Use the node to reference Class types of nodes within Project Definition Hierarchies to map entire structures of definitions.
The first two use cases are self-explanatory. Let's explore the third one in more detail.

Use a Weight Votes Switch node to establish a reference with a Class type of node — Pool Class, Position Class, Feature Class, or Asset Class — within Project Definition Hierarchies. Then use the Install Missing Votes option on the menu of the Weight Votes Switch to map the entire Class section of the hierarchy!
The process creates a Weight Votes Switch for each Class type of node, and matching Weight Votes for each Asset, Feature, Position, or Pool defined within each Class node.

If something changes on the side of the definitions, you may always go back a run the Install Missing Votes process again. The process will remap the structure with the appropriate votes and switches.
